title: Design of Mathematics Problem-Solving Strategies Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics concepts (functions, equations, statistics) and foundational cognitive psychology theories
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based learning environment emphasizing real-time interaction and individualized feedback

learning_goals: Apply and explain the three types of Cognitive Load Theory (CLT) (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) to actual math problems
Predict and optimize cognitive load of learning tasks using a problem complexity framework
Develop and evaluate math problem-solving strategies tailored to individual information-processing capacities through experimental design methods

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
